required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Cariprazine as an Adjunctive Treatment to Antidepressant Therapy (ADT) in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Cariprazine as Adjunctive Therapy in Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of cariprazine as an adjunctive treatment to antidepressant therapy (ADT) in patients with MDD

primary_outcome.measure: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) at Baseline in the Double-Blind Period
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the past week. Patients are rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating and lack of interest. Each item is scored on a 7-point scale. A score of 0 indicates the absence of symptoms, and a score of 6 indicates symptoms of maximum severity for a total possible score of 0 to 60.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) in the Double-Blind Period
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the past week. Participants are rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating and lack of interest. Each item is scored on a 7-point scale. A score of 0 indicates the absence of symptoms, and a score of 6 indicates symptoms of maximum severity for a total possible score of 0 to 60. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. Mixed-effects model for repeated measures (MMRM) with treatment group, study center, visit, and treatment group-by-visit interaction as fixed effects, and the baseline value and baseline by-visit interaction as the covariates was used for analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) Score in the Double-Blind Period
secondary_outcome.description: The Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) is a 3-item patient-rated questionnaire used to evaluate impairments in the domains of work, social life/leisure, and family life/home responsibility. All items are rated on an 11-point continuum from 0 (no impairment) to 10 (most severe). The 3 individual scores are summed for a total possible score of 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement. MMRM with treatment group, study center, visit, and treatment group-by-visit interaction as fixed effects, and the baseline value and baseline by-visit interaction as the covariates was used for analyses.

arm_group.description: Antidepressant therapy (ADT) as prescribed by the investigator plus single-blind placebo for 8 weeks.
Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period participants were randomized to dose-matched placebo, once per day, oral administration plus ADT for 8 weeks (up to Week 16).

Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period participants were randomized to cariprazine, 1.5 to 4.5 milligrams (mg) per day, oral administration plus ADT for 8 weeks (up to Week 16).
Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period, participants who were ADT responders continued treatment with ADT plus placebo for an additional 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Dose-matched placebo capsule once per day
ADT such as bupropion, citalopram, desvenlafaxine, duloxetine, escitalopram, fluoxetine, sertraline, venlafaxine, paroxetine or vilazodone as prescribed by the physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have provided consent prior to any specific procedure
- Meet the The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th edition, text revision (DSM-IV-TR) criteria for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
- Have a minimum score of 20 on 17-Item Hamilton Depression (HAMD-17) rating scale at Visits 1 and 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who do not meet DSM-IV-TR criteria for MDD

link.description: Link to detailed contact information on study locations

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 1022 patients participated in an 8 week open label antidepression therapy (ADT) + single blind placebo lead-in period. 530 patients who did not respond were randomized to receive ADT or cariprazine + ADT in the double-blind period and non-responders continued ADT + Placebo.

group.title: Placebo + ADT Lead-in
group.description: Antidepressant therapy (ADT) as prescribed by the investigator plus single-blind placebo for 8 weeks.

group.title: Placebo + ADT (Double-Blind)
group.description: Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period participants were randomized to dose-matched placebo, once per day, oral administration plus ADT for 8 weeks (up to Week 16).

group.title: Cariprazine + ADT (Double-Blind)
group.description: Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period participants were randomized to cariprazine, 1.5 to 4.5 milligrams (mg) per day, oral administration plus ADT for 8 weeks (up to Week 16).

group.title: Placebo + ADT (Continued Treatment)
group.description: Following the 8 week ADT plus single blind placebo lead-in period, participants who were ADT responders continued treatment with ADT plus placebo for an additional 8 weeks.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Study or Site Terminated by Sponsor

baseline.population: Pre-Randomization Safety Population included all patients in the screened population who took at least 1 dose of prospective open-label ADT plus single-blind placebo during the prospective ADT lead-in period of the study.

group.title: Placebo + ADT Lead-in
group.description: Antidepressant therapy (ADT) as prescribed by the investigator plus single-blind placebo for 8 weeks.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) at Baseline in the Double-Blind Period
outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the past week. Patients are rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating and lack of interest. Each item is scored on a 7-point scale. A score of 0 indicates the absence of symptoms, and a score of 6 indicates symptoms of maximum severity for a total possible score of 0 to 60.
outcome.population: Double-blind Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population included all participants in the double-blind safety population who had a randomization baseline assessment and at least 1 postbaseline assessment of the MADRS total score during the double-blind treatment period.

reported_events.time_frame: First dose of study drug up to 30 days past last dose of study drug (Up to 12 Weeks for the ADT Lead-In arm) and up to an additional 12 weeks for the Double-Blind and Continued Treatment arms
reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events at a threshold of >=2% were analyzed separately for Lead-in, Double-Blind and Continued Treatment arms.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
